backend_llm_notes: GPT-5 via Cursor Agent Mode - Advanced reasoning and instruction following
original_prompt: Starting next week, I want a weekly 30-min 1:1 with {name}. Afternoons preferred, avoid Fridays. Automatically reschedule on declines or conflicts.

gutts.name: Constraint Extraction & Formalization
gutts.capability: Parse scheduling requirements into structured constraints
gutts.evidence: Extracted constraints: weekly recurrence, 30min duration, afternoons (12pm-6pm), exclude Fridays

gutts.name: Multi-Calendar Availability Checking
gutts.capability: Check free/busy status for user and attendee
gutts.user_goal: Find times when both parties are free
gutts.evidence: Queried calendars for user and {name}, found 8 overlapping free slots next week

gutts.name: Constraint-Based Slot Finding
gutts.capability: Identify time slots matching all constraints (weekly, afternoons, not Fridays, 30min)
gutts.user_goal: Get valid time options that meet preferences
gutts.evidence: Filtered to 3 afternoon slots (Mon 2pm, Tue 3pm, Wed 4pm) excluding Fridays

gutts.name: Recurring Meeting Series Creation
gutts.capability: Create recurring calendar event with proper series configuration
gutts.user_goal: One-time setup creates ongoing weekly meetings
gutts.evidence: Created recurring event: RRULE:FREQ=WEEKLY;BYDAY=TU starting next Tuesday 3pm

gutts.name: Meeting Invitation Sending
gutts.evidence: Sent calendar invitation to {name} with subject 'Weekly 1:1' and RSVP request

gutts.name: Decline/Conflict Detection & Monitoring
gutts.capability: Monitor for attendee declines or new calendar conflicts
gutts.user_goal: System knows when rescheduling is needed
gutts.evidence: Set up webhook/polling to monitor RSVP status and calendar changes for both parties

gutts.name: Automatic Rescheduling Logic
gutts.capability: When declined/conflicted, find new slot and send updated invitation

notes: Generated by GPT-5 - Matches reference decomposition of 7 GUTTs
